channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Israel strikes Lebanon and Gaza after major rocket attack
item.description: Israel's military hit targets linked to Palestinian group Hamas after a rocket barrage from Lebanon.

item.title: Two British-Israeli women killed in West Bank shooting
item.description: The sisters were driving in a car in the Jordan Valley with their mother, who was seriously injured.

item.title: Supreme Court's Clarence Thomas defends luxury trips
item.description: Clarence Thomas says guidelines were followed after a report revealed vacations funded by a billionaire.

item.title: Russian rouble falls to lowest value for a year
item.description: The currency tumbles against the dollar as Western sanctions continue.

item.title: Evan Gershkovich: Russia charges US journalist with spying - reports
item.description: Evan Gershkovich, who was arrested last week, categorically rejects the accusations, reports say.

item.title: XXXTentacion: Three men jailed for life over rapper's death
item.description: The chart-topping rising star was shot in broad daylight during a 2018 robbery in Florida.

item.title: Tennessee Democrat expelled over gun protest
item.description: The lawmakers halted proceedings and chanted "power to the people" as part of an anti-gun protest.

item.title: People were taking drugs in Spain 3,000 years ago, study finds
item.description: A new study finds people in Menorca got high on hallucinogenic drugs during the Bronze Age.

item.title: Nigeria gunmen kill dozens in rural village in Benue State
item.description: At least 51 people die in an attack in Benue State, where people are searching for more bodies.

item.title: Stormy Daniels: Trump doesn't deserve prison for hush money
item.description: The former adult film actress says she felt sadness when seeing Mr Trump in court this week.

item.title: Life sentences for DR Congo Italian envoy's killers
item.description: The men are accused of killing Luca Attanasio and two others after attacking a UN convoy in DR Congo.

item.title: Chained woman case: Six jailed in trafficking case that horrified China
item.description: The woman - a human trafficking victim - was found locked in a hut with a chain around her neck.

item.title: Jeremy Renner describes snowplough accident: 'My mistake and I paid for it'
item.description: "It's my mistake and I paid for it," the actor says in his first interview since being badly injured.

item.title: Expelled Tennessee lawmaker Justin Jones vows to return - but can he?
item.description: Expulsion is extraordinary, but Democrat Justin Jones can see a way back to the statehouse.

item.title: Quiz of the week: Which relative of JFK is challenging Biden?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: Earth, water, leaf
item.description: A selection of the best photos from across Africa and beyond this week.

item.title: One Romanian family's fatal attempt to reach the US
item.description: What drove the Iordache family to make a desperate bid to reach the US from Canada?

item.title: Bloodywood: From Indian parody band to metal music royalty
item.description: Can the Delhi-based musicians change the course of metal music in India?

item.title: The cost of the Ukraine war for one Russian regiment
item.description: The decline of the "elite" 331st regiment can be measured in loss to machinery and personnel.

item.title: Indian Railways: Why trains still kill thousands of cattle every year
item.description: More than 13,000 cattle were run over by trains in 2022, government data shows.

item.title: Eurovision 2023: Every song ranked, from Albania to the UK
item.description: All 37 countries have now submitted their entries. But which are the gems and what are the duds?

item.title: 'We turned down a client to uphold gay rights'
item.description: The global B Corp business accreditation scheme rewards firms that behave ethically.

item.title: Forget a K9 unit, this police station has a bunny
item.description: Meet Officer Hops, the Yuba City Police Department's furry 'wellness officer'.

item.title: The damage done by 80 tornadoes in a week
item.description: Since 31 March more than 80 tornadoes have been reported, killing at least 30 people across the US.

item.title: France pension protests: One of Macron's favourite cafes in flames
item.description: Protesters against raising France's retirement age attack La Rotonde bistro in Paris.

item.title: The moment lightning strikes the tip of Toronto's CN Tower
item.description: Lightning struck the famous tower early on Wednesday morning.

item.title: UK and US walk out on Russia's Lvova-Belova at UN meeting
item.description: The UK, US, Albania and Malta walked out as Russia's envoy for children's rights spoke via video.

item.title: Dalaneo Martin: Bodycam video shows US officer shoot teen in back
item.description: The justice department investigates the death of a teen shot by an officer sitting behind him in a car.
